programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team from London, UK, in English.

programme.title: France 24 English News
programme.desc: International news and current affairs television from Paris, offering a French perspective on world events, in English.

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul faces his biggest challenge yet as he tries to find homes for dozens of dogs whove all arrived together. Top of Pauls Christmas list is a West Highland Terrier called Sylvester who is very withdrawn and needs to be brought out of his shell. Paul enlists the help of a beautiful Bichon Frise called Harlow, who becomes Batterseas resident therapy dog for dogs to help him spread festive joy.

programme.title: Kew Gardens: Season by Season
programme.desc: In this one off special, we celebrate Christmas at one of Britains best known and most popular destinations: The Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew.

programme.title: The Streets with Dan Hong
programme.desc: Water, cornmeal, salt: Dan explores a South American classic, the arepa, then adds his twist by pairing it with South Asian favours. Dan then creates a Singaporean favourite and puts a new spin on the iconic Hawker Hall staple. Finally, Dan layers crispy chips, gravy and cheese curd to create Canadas most iconic street food, poutine.

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets Springwatch presenter and biologist Gillian Burke who takes Rick on a walk through a rare habitat called an Atlantic Temperate Rainforest, on the banks of the Helford River.

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Cornwall has more than its fair share of folk tales. Perhaps the most famous is found near Lands End, where Rick recounts the tale of the Mermaid of Zennor.

programme.title: Masters of Savours
programme.desc: Meet the passionate people who have made bread their profession. Whether in France, Greece, or Italy, bread is a symbol coated with traditions and a source of social bonds.

programme.title: Tareq Taylors Nordic Cookery
programme.sub-title: Greater Copenhagen: Roof Gardens and Design Castles
programme.desc: Copenhagen and Skane are hot food destinations. Tareq visits Ostergro, Denmarks first rooftop farm, Eden in the new district of Hyllie, Malmo and Hackeberga Castle.

programme.title: Lucas Key Ingredient
programme.desc: Luca explores the best of both Italian and Australian produce, while emphasising on his carefully selected key ingredients. His innovative approach to cooking promises to leave you feeling satisfied.

programme.title: On Country Kitchen
programme.desc: On the coast at Jervis Bay, Derek helps Joel and Adrian to dive for lobsters off the rocks while Mark tends to the fire; in Ulladulla, the boys get a taste for the cheesemaking life with Rosie and Angel, and relax on the picturesque deck with a wine and cheese in hand, soaking up the mid-afternoon sun; inland at Milton, the boys are put to the task of eating as little produce as possible when chocolate-making with Jo and Dan; Mark and Derek indulge in a heart-to-heart kayaking down the Kangaroo Valley River.

programme.title: My Greek Table With Diane Kochilas
programme.sub-title: Flavors of The Athenian Art Scene
programme.desc: Diane prepares a meal for some of her closest friends. On the menu: char-broiled cabbage steaks with pomegranate seeds and lemon zest and a greek yogurt panna cotta.

programme.title: Taste of Australia with Hayden Quinn
programme.desc: Hayden explores the wild beauty of North West Tasmania, where dramatic coastlines and lush farmlands produce some of the countrys finest ingredients. Along the way, he meets the people who bring this food lovers paradise to life.

programme.title: Lidias Kitchen
programme.desc: Everyone deserves to feel welcomed, especially in my home, and I will always be sure that there are options for you all.

programme.title: My Market Kitchen
programme.desc: Laura makes her delicious Spinach and Feta Rolls in the heart of the Prahran Market. In the Yarra Valley, Charlie Carrington cooks Chicken Enchiladas.

programme.title: Freshly Picked with Simon Toohey
programme.desc: Join Simon Toohey in Freshly Picked, back for an exciting fourth season packed with bold flavours, creative plant-based dishes, and a celebration of sustainable cooking.

programme.title: Everyday Gourmet with Justine Schofield
programme.desc: French-Style Veal Stew, Peanut Butter Curry and Soy Chocolate Gelato- there is something for everybody in todays episode!

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella Lawsons mission to show how easy it is to bring the spirit of Italy into the kitchen continues as she shares the secrets of her celebratory, yet simple, Italian roast chicken, served alongside a sunny saffron orzotto. Dessert comes courtesy of Nigellas surprisingly easy coffee ice cream, inspired by lazy days spent in the ice cream parlours of Florence, and an extra treat is presented in the form of a chocolate olive oil cake.

programme.title: Rachael Rays Holidays
programme.desc: Rachael shows how to make delicious lasagna by layering sheets of pasta with cime di rapa, ricotta, and a ragu sauce that includes sweet sausage. Its then covered with cheese and baked to perfection.

programme.title: The Cook Up with Adam Liaw
programme.desc: Samantha Harris and Karl Firla join Adam in the kitchen to give you some great ideas for dishes to make for a festive take-a-plate.

programme.title: Donals Family Kitchen
programme.desc: Each year, Donal sits down to plan his family Christmas menu and tries to do something different and challenging.

programme.title: Shane Delias Malta
programme.desc: Shane travels further back in time to discover the incredible legacy left by the Phoenicians, including what is quite possibly Maltas national dish-rabbit.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Spain
programme.desc: Galicia is Spains best kept secret, so remote and wild the Romans thought it was the end of the world - yet so rich in natural resources and landscapes that its sensational produce is truly out of this world.

programme.title: The Cook and the Chef
programme.desc: While wandering through Adelaides Himeji Gardens, Simon recalls an inspirational trip to Japan and the insights he gained about its chefs discipline and their treatment of fish. He returned to Australia with an extraordinary knife made by artisans who once crafted Samurai swords.

programme.title: Everyday Gourmet with Justine Schofield
programme.desc: French-Style Veal Stew, Peanut Butter Curry and Soy Chocolate Gelato- there is something for everybody in todays episode!

programme.title: The Cook Up with Adam Liaw
programme.desc: Samantha Harris and Karl Firla join Adam in the kitchen to give you some great ideas for dishes to make for a festive take-a-plate.

programme.title: Cheese Slices
programme.sub-title: Mozzarella and the Cheese of Campania, Italy
programme.desc: Will journeys to Italys picturesque Campania region to look at stretched curd cheeses and finds it hard to resist the lingering flavour and sensual texture of buffalo cheese made from raw milk. After learning about Italys oldest ewes milk cheese, which is matured in a terracotta jar, Will gets a lesson from a countess in how to make the perfect wood-fired pizza. He then heads to the coast to look at cacao Cavallo, a traditional stretched curd cheese made with cows milk, before visiting the underground maturation rooms of Casa Madaio, where the finest examples are aged.

programme.title: Masters of Savours
programme.desc: Until a few years ago, olive oil was a common ingredient in Mediterranean cuisine. However, passionate growers have recently consistently improved quality and taste to the point of making their products indispensable for the best chefs. We journey where these nectars can be found, often nestled in magnificent landscapes: the plains of Tuscany in Italy, the fields of Drome in France, the Peloponnese in Greece, and Spain.

programme.title: Tareq Taylors Nordic Cookery
programme.desc: The wild coast at Kullaberg in Skane has a lot of culture and gastronomy to offer: fantastic ceramics, vineyards and world-class ice cream. Tareq visits VikenTomater and cooks vegetarian ragu.

programme.title: Lucas Key Ingredient
programme.desc: Luca shows us his favourite recipes using the key ingredient potato.

programme.title: On Country Kitchen
programme.desc: Mark and Derek learn about the overabundance of sea urchin, and explore a new type of sustainable farming in Berrima; the boys have a go at beekeeping.

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: Mary travels to Scotland to enjoy the best of their everyday larder. She discovers wonderful shellfish in Ullapool, shares the joys of BBQ with chef Tom Kitchin and whips up a whisky cream.

programme.title: Taste of Australia with Hayden Quinn
programme.desc: Still in Tasmanias north west, Hayden hunts down the ultimate ingredients for his dream dessert-cooked on a BBQ. From windswept shores to artisan kitchens, this is Tasmania at its most delicious.

programme.title: Lidias Kitchen
programme.desc: There are two strategies when it comes to hosting, either you make the food in advance or you put on a show!

programme.title: My Market Kitchen
programme.desc: Dietitian Simone Austin joins Laura in the market to make a dish that not only tastes great but is also good for your gut health: Braised Greens and Spelt Pasta.

programme.title: Freshly Picked with Simon Toohey
programme.desc: Simon dives into Mexican-inspired plant-based cuisine with his garlic mushroom tostada and spices up the menu with Hasselback celeriac. He also prepares dill pickles and ends on a sweet note with soft serve. Georgia Irwin joins him to bake a delicious tea cake.

programme.title: Everyday Gourmet with Justine Schofield
programme.desc: Join Justine as she prepares Salmon Blinis at Edith Falls from her most recent trip to the Northern Territory.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella shares the secrets of delicious Italian-inspired food. She treats her friends to an Italian-style supper of pork loin stuffed with parma ham and oregano, served alongside her speedy mock mash and lazy persons vignarola - a recipe based on the traditional Roman spring stew of broad beans, peas and artichokes.

programme.title: Rachael Rays Holidays
programme.sub-title: Cheese Fondue With Vegetables, Sausage And Beef Tips
programme.desc: Rachael shows how to make her version of an easy and decadent Fundue to impress holiday guests and bring everyone around the table.

programme.title: The Cook Up with Adam Liaw
programme.desc: Adam, food icon Maggie Beer and Baker Natalie Paull are in the kitchen making savoury dishes that can be the centre of your Christmas buffet.

programme.title: Silvias Italian Masterclass
programme.desc: Sivia highlights that you dont have to give up the food you love regardless of dietary requirements. Whether youre cooking savoury or sweet, Italian food is for everyone.

programme.title: The Big Irish Food Tour
programme.desc: Boarding the train to the North Coast, Anna travels along a stretch of railway described as one of the most spectacular railway journeys in the Ireland to meet Derry Girls actor Ian McElhinney.

programme.title: Jose Andres and Family in Spain
programme.desc: Chef Jose Andres and his daughters go on a mission to discover the origins of Spanish paella in Valencia.

programme.title: The Cook and the Chef
programme.desc: Maggie Beer, the cook who in so many ways defines regional cuisine, owes her success to what she describes as the audacity to embark on a journey based on nothing more than an instinct to cook. She reveals her secrets for cooking the bird that started it all.

programme.title: Everyday Gourmet with Justine Schofield
programme.desc: Join Justine as she prepares Salmon Blinis at Edith Falls from her most recent trip to the Northern Territory.

programme.title: The Cook Up with Adam Liaw

programme.title: Cheese Slices
programme.desc: The upper Midwest state is famous for its cheese heads and proudly declares itself Americas Dairyland because it produces more cheese than any other state in the USA. But since the 1950s, most of the original traditional cheese types have been replaced by bland and predictable mass-produced Swiss and Cheddar. Will visits several of the exciting new farmstead cheese producers, including Uplands Cheese Company, before meeting Willi Lehner at Bleu Mont Dairy to see how he ripens cheese in an underground cave. Finally, Will heads for the hills to look at Hidden Springs Creamery, where an organic ewes milk cheese is being made with the help of local Amish farmers.

programme.title: Masters of Savours
programme.desc: Until a few years ago, olive oil was a common ingredient in Mediterranean cuisine. However, passionate growers have recently consistently improved quality and taste to the point of making their products indispensable for the best chefs. We journey where these nectars can be found, often nestled in magnificent landscapes: the plains of Tuscany in Italy, the fields of Drome in France, the Peloponnese in Greece, and Spain.

programme.desc: Mark and Derek learn about the overabundance of sea urchin, and explore a new type of sustainable farming in Berrima; the boys have a go at beekeeping.

programme.desc: Mary travels to Scotland to enjoy the best of their everyday larder. She discovers wonderful shellfish in Ullapool, shares the joys of BBQ with chef Tom Kitchin and whips up a whisky cream.

programme.desc: Still in Tasmanias north west, Hayden hunts down the ultimate ingredients for his dream dessert-cooked on a BBQ. From windswept shores to artisan kitchens, this is Tasmania at its most delicious.

programme.title: Lidias Kitchen
programme.desc: There are two strategies when it comes to hosting, either you make the food in advance or you put on a show!

programme.title: Masters of Savours
programme.desc: For almost a decade, the world of roasting has been in the midst of a revolution with the so-called specialty coffee. These coffees are being tended in exceptional places such as the Finca Bora in Panama, the Reunion Island, or the heights of Cali in Colombia. This program shows us the complexity of this plant through the men and women who watch over it with passion.

programme.title: Tareq Taylors Nordic Cookery
programme.desc: Tareq visits sunny Karlstad! Here, food is prepared by Vanerns shores and in Varmlands deep forests. Butter-fried Zander, crepes and cooking over an open fire are on the menu.

programme.title: Lucas Key Ingredient
programme.desc: Luca shows us his favourite recipes using the key ingredient, Parmigiano Reggiano.

programme.title: On Country Kitchen
programme.desc: Mark and Derek take a tour around the historic ghost town of Joadja and help with the distilling process with the Jimenez family. Like Derek, Valero doesnt drink - an interesting challenge for a head distiller. At the Dapto Community Garden, they collect kohlrabi with Harry, and over in Gerringong they stumble upon a coffee plantation on a picturesque hill. They retire for a game of cricket at the Bradman Museum in Bowral and learn about the rich Indigenous history of the sport in Australia.

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: Mary shares everyday dishes full of wholesome goodness from her secret tip for a rich bolognaise to a heart-warming soup. She dons a white suit and tries her hand at bee keeping and collecting honey.

programme.title: Taste of Australia with Hayden Quinn
programme.desc: Hayden is in the New England Highlands with a visit to the biggest glasshouse weve ever seen, learning some Celtic culture in Glen Innes, and a campfire cook up on a stunning lamb farm hosted by a 5th generation farming family! What a way to start the season.

programme.title: Lidias Kitchen
programme.desc: When the weather cools down and its the season of celebrating, I find my favorite place to be is right here, cooking up memories for all those special occasions.

programme.title: My Market Kitchen
programme.desc: Laura uses local Adelaide Hills produce to make her delicious Red Wine Poached Pears. Chef Charlie Carrington and farmer Catherine Velisha join forces to showcase spring onions with a unique Zaatar.

programme.title: Freshly Picked with Simon Toohey
programme.desc: Chef Jack Brown joins Simon in the kitchen to prepare a delicate baked eggplant. Simon follows with a plant-based cheesy topping, crispy fried patra, and two creamy dishes that will leave you craving more.

programme.title: Everyday Gourmet with Justine Schofield
programme.desc: Everyday Gourmet friend Warren Mendes is back to prepare Crispy Beef Ban Dan Noodles and later Justine prepares Alfajores, buttery shortbread sandwhiched with rich caramel sauce, whats not to love?

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella shares her culinary talent as she presents delicious Italian-inspired food. In this episode, Nigella reveals a secret passion for one of the tastes of Italy with her dark and deviant liquorice pudding, before introducing us to the joys of fregola - the Sardinian sun-dried and toasted couscous - in a light, tomato-hued recipe of couscous with clams.

programme.title: Rachael Rays Holidays
programme.desc: Rachael shows how to prepare a show-stopping, meat-free holiday meal that everyone will love! First, she makes a rich and flavorful pumpkin soup using Italian pumpkins.

programme.title: The Cook Up with Adam Liaw
programme.desc: Its a big night with Adam, Chef George Calombaris, and singer Christine Anu in the kitchen, creating festive food unique to their homes.

programme.title: Mark Moriarty - Cook Like A Chef
programme.desc: Each week, chef Mark Moriarty transforms a few core ingredients into three knockout dishes-using smart techniques, pantry staples, and a chefs eye for flavour. Cook smarter, waste less, and learn how to Cook Like a Chef.

programme.title: Global Soul Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Deborah VanTrece combines the flavors of Morocco, Tunisia, and Louisiana by making savory cheddar cheese grits topped with eggs in purgatory, a dish made with spicy tomato sauce.

programme.title: Two Greedy Italians
programme.desc: Chefs Antonio Carluccio and Gennaro Contaldo tour Italy to discover how their home countrys culture has changed since they left more than 40 years ago, and how this has affected the way the population eats. Beginning in Emilia Romagna, the home of prosciutto and parmesan cheese, the pair have Sunday lunch with a traditional family, before meeting a group of career women in Bologna who do not cook at home any more.

programme.title: The Cook and the Chef
programme.desc: Simon and Maggie celebrate new season pumpkins. As well as advising everyone to use that bit of spare space at home to grow them. Simon takes his home grown pumpkins, crusts them with Dukkah and then roasts them.

programme.title: Everyday Gourmet with Justine Schofield
programme.desc: Everyday Gourmet friend Warren Mendes is back to prepare Crispy Beef Ban Dan Noodles and later Justine prepares Alfajores, buttery shortbread sandwhiched with rich caramel sauce, whats not to love?

programme.title: The Cook Up with Adam Liaw
programme.desc: Its a big night with Adam, Chef George Calombaris, and singer Christine Anu in the kitchen, creating festive food unique to their homes.

programme.title: Cheese Slices
programme.desc: Squeaky, salty halloumi is one of the worlds best-loved grilled cheeses. However, most of it is now mass produced using cows milk. Will travels to the island of Cyprus to see how traditional halloumi is still made from a mixture of goats and ewes milk. After discovering a fresh, mild whey cheese called anari, he then visits one of the last farm producers still making halloumi the old-fashioned way from raw milk. Finally, Will checks out some unusual ways to cook this delicious cheese in his home town of Melbourne.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Pundit, presenter and former world-class footballer Alex Scott delves into both sides of her family history in Who Do You Think You Are? Having known nothing of her Jewish ancestry on her mums side, Alex is proud to discover that her great grandad was at the Battle of Cable Street in Londons East End in 1936, facing down Fascist followers of Oswald Mosley.

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team from London, UK, in English.

programme.title: France 24 International News
programme.desc: International news and current affairs television from Paris, offering a French perspective on world events, in English.

programme.title: PBS News Weekend
programme.desc: Analysis of national and international news, as well as in-depth reporting on topics ranging from education and politics to technology and finance. Hosted by John Yang for the Public Broadcasting Service (PBS) in the United States.

programme.title: Al Jazeera News Hour
programme.desc: In-depth global news from Al Jazeera Satellite Network, Doha, Qatar, in English.

programme.title: Amazon The Lost World
programme.desc: Deep in the Amazon rainforest, archaeologists are discovering new evidence that reveals five centuries of exploitation by gold miners, loggers, and even slave traders. Was this the cause of a massive population crash that almost wiped out an entire Amazon civilisation? And can todays indigenous Amazonians preserve thousands of years of unbroken heritage, under a renewed onslaught of deforestation, gold fever, and urbanisation?

programme.title: Such Was Life
programme.desc: Laurel Cooper was taken to the Mount Margaret Mission by her mother at a time when Aboriginal children were routinely taken away from their families.

programme.title: The Cook Up with Adam Liaw
programme.desc: Its Christmas week, so two of Australias greatest performers, Courtney Act and Mitch Tambo, join Adam to celebrate the festive period with the perfect snacks.

programme.title: Westminster Abbey: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: In an ever-changing modern world, the Abbey remains the one constant. With the recent changes in the monarchy and parliament, how does the Abbey remain an evolving but reliable presence for the masses?

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: Ken Jennings hosts Jeopardy! Where the answers are revealed and the contestants must guess the appropriate questions.

programme.title: Letters and Numbers
programme.desc: Two contestants pit their linguistic and numerical skills against each other and the clock in this entertaining quiz show. Join host Richard Morecroft along with maths whiz Lily Serna and wordsmith David Astle.

programme.title: Mastermind Australia
programme.desc: Tonights specialty subjects are: The Films of Steven Spielberg, August: Osage County, Green Day and the Zodiac Academy Book 1 to 3. Contenders: Luis Sanchez, Bianca Reynolds, Lachlan Willacy, Luisa Di Pompo.

programme.title: SBS World News
programme.desc: The latest reports and analysis of major national and international news of the day from Australias only world news service.

programme.title: Secrets of the Tasmanian Tiger
programme.desc: This episode explores a unique dig site in Australia that could help solve the mystery of how the Tasmanian tiger became extinct.

programme.title: Never Mind the Buzzcocks
programme.sub-title: Daisy May Cooper, Chris Ramsey, Ella Henderson, Jordan North
programme.desc: Get ready for festive chaos with the hour-long Never Mind the Buzzcocks Christmas Special! Daisy May Cooper returns as a festive treat, joining host Greg Davies, Noel Fielding, and Jamali Maddix for some wonderful and very rude Christmas cheer. Guests include comedian Chris Ramsey, DJ Jordan North, and singer Ella Henderson.

programme.title: I Literally Just Told You
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr presents a brand-new gameshow with a unique twist. Four contestants compete for up to 25,000 pounds, answering questions written live as the show films - covering everything from celebrity cameos to Jimmys own jokes. Memory skills are crucial in the nerve-wracking final showdown.

programme.title: The 2010s
programme.desc: Press play on a new era of ground-breaking television, ushering in new types of storytelling from new creators driven by a new type of competition: the streaming service wars.

programme.title: The Man Who Died
programme.desc: Jaakko finally finds the mole. Now he is on the trail of a killer, but time is running out.

programme.title: Culprits
programme.desc: Specialist is living her new life in a remote wilderness but is surprised by an unexpected visitor. Joes paranoia and fear grow. His conflict with Kyle takes a violent turn and Jules is horrified by Joes confession. Joe breaks protocol, contacts one of the other Culprits, and embarks on a mission to neutralize the looming threat.

programme.title: Culprits
programme.desc: In London, Joe, Specialist, and Officer are reunited and they try to figure out who is killing the crew and why. They agree to team up, but Specialist vanishes. Another murder rocks Joe and, they travel to France hoping to find fellow Culprits before the killer does.

programme.title: Pagan Peak
programme.desc: When the serial killer strikes closer to home, Ellie reunites with her old colleague Gedeon and returns to duty, ready to solve a murder.

programme.title: Pagan Peak
programme.desc: Ellie and Gedeon use force to gain access to important documents when a young woman is kidnapped. The trail leads to the influential building contractor family Gossen.

programme.title: Growing a Greener World
programme.sub-title: From Seed To Fork: Growing An Abundant And Beautiful Cold-Climate Garden (Minneapolis, Mn)
programme.desc: We all like our gardens to be as productive as possible for the time and energy we invest. But when it comes to getting the most out of what a garden can provide, Meg Cowden never misses an opportunity to push the limits. Despite the short growing season and challenging conditions of her cold western Twin Cities climate, shes obsessed with gardening and discovering new ways to grow more and do it better.

programme.title: NHK World English News Morning
programme.desc: English news from Japans Broadcasting Corporation, NHK, delivering the latest in business, technology, health, environmental and world news.

programme.title: ANC Philippines The World Tonight
programme.desc: Delivers the top stories of the day, covering political, economic, and social sectors on both local and global fronts.

programme.title: DW English News
programme.desc: News and analysis of the top international and European news and current affairs from Berlin, in English.

programme.title: Al Jazeera News
programme.desc: News via satellite from Al Jazeera Satellite Network, Qatar, in English.

programme.title: BBC 6 OClock News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team from London, UK, in English.

programme.title: France 24 English News
programme.desc: International news and current affairs television from Paris, offering a French perspective on world events, in English.

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul OGrady returns to Battersea Dogs and Cats Home in a special Christmas episode. Determined to bring some much-needed festive cheer to the canine residents, Paul will again bring his unique blend of heartfelt warmth and humour to the waifs and strays of Battersea as he tries to give the dogs the best Christmas present possible: a new home.

programme.title: Inside Oxford Street
programme.desc: Only when the shops are closed and Oxford street is quiet, can the team from Thames Water come out at night to look for underground water leaks.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian Josh Widdicombe embarks on a rollercoaster ride through his extraordinary family history. After a less than promising start with an ancestor who was cut out of the family fortune. Josh is delighted to discover a courtier with very personal access to King Charles I.

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team from London, UK, in English.

programme.title: France 24 International News

programme.title: PBS NewsHour
programme.desc: Reviews and analysis of the days news presented by Amna Nawaz and Geoff Bennett for the Public Broadcasting Service (PBS) in the United States.

programme.title: Darcey Bussells Royal Road Trip
programme.desc: Dame Darcy Bussell embarks on a road trip around Britain in celebration of places that meant so much to Queen Elizabeth II. Darcy begins her journey in the Scottish Highlands. The one event the Queen never missed on her summer holidays at Balmoral is the Highland Games, where Darcey tosses the caber and discovers what its like to have the Queen as a neighbour.

programme.title: Such Was Life
programme.desc: Charlie Webb ran a tiny pub in a small mining town and is immortalised in the Henry Lawsons poem, The Bulletin Hotel. Pubs, breweries and publicans flourished in the arid Goldfields at a time when beer was cheaper to drink than water. They became the centre of social life in their communities.

programme.title: The Cook Up with Adam Liaw
programme.desc: Samantha Harris and Karl Firla join Adam in the kitchen to give you some great ideas for dishes to make for a festive take-a-plate.

programme.title: Westminster Abbey: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Christmas is the Abbeys most intense time of year, and the season kicks off with Advent. Relative newbie, Minor Canon Bob oversees this dramatic service, which involves multiple candles held aloft that represent the light of Christ coming into the world. Music is a vital part of the DNA of the Abbey. Under the close eye of Choir Master James ODonnell, the choristers rehearse for Christmas carol concerts to come.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: At the former Midlothian mining village of Newtongrange, Michael meets the son of a miner whose name loomed large in the disputes of the 1970s and 1980s: vice-president of the National Union of Mineworkers, Red Mick McGahey.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Dundee to Loch of The Lowes
programme.desc: Michaels rail journey through post-war Scotland takes him over the River Tay to Dundee, Scotlands fourth largest city. He is on the trail of Joseph McKenzie, the father of modern Scottish photography.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Popstar Olly Murs is a quarter Latvian on his dads side but knows nothing about his Latvian heritage. He travels to the capital Riga and discovers that his late granddad Eddie was born after an affair between his great grandparents who were both circus performers. During the Second World War Ollys great grandmother made the heart-breaking decision to send her son out of Latvia with his father and stepmother.

programme.title: Australia in Colour
programme.desc: Those in authority in Australia at the time of Federation envisage a prosperous and civilised nation of hardworking citizens. But modern Australia grew out of a drunken penal colony, and people remain under the thrall of alcohol and drugs and are fascinated by murder and mischief. But the public do rise up against capital punishment and it is abolished nation wide.

programme.title: The 2010s
programme.desc: Music in the 2010s underwent profound change, both technologically and sonically. The rise of streaming services like Spotify radically transformed the landscape, at once reviving a record industry that had been decimated by pirating services like Napster, while also introducing new economic incentives to artists that would change the way music itself was made.

programme.title: Families Like Ours
programme.sub-title: A Time To Get And A Time To Lose
programme.desc: Things are looking bleak. Elias is beaten within an inch of his life by uniformed men and abandoned on a Polish beach. Laura, waiting for Elias in vain, boards the last train to Bucharest. She is finally reunited with her surprised mother. For a moment, they feel like the luckiest people alive. Jacob and Amalie travel to the south of France on their last penny, hoping for the help of a hotel manager Amalie visited as a child.

programme.title: De Gaulle
programme.desc: As France plunges into turmoil, De Gaulle fails to grasp the true stakes at hand. Those surrounding Pompidou demand De Gaulles departure. With events refusing to subside, dissidents launch a general strike and ignite a student rebellion.

programme.title: De Gaulle
programme.desc: At the end of 1968, with Pompidou no longer serving as Prime Minister, Charles de Gaulle chooses to embark on a remarkable political endeavour: a referendum on Senate reform and regionalisation.

programme.title: Nordland 99
programme.desc: Lukas, Emma, and Kris are going back to the cabin, where they make an awful discovery. At the same time, Christian reviews the surveillance material from the gas station.

programme.title: Nordland 99
programme.desc: The whole town is in mourning, and the search for Alex takes a new turn. Christian is no longer on the case but makes a promise to an old friend.

programme.title: Nordland 99
programme.desc: Kris gives up being part of the search team for Alex, while Lukas and Emma end up in danger. Meanwhile, Christian gets an unexpected visit.

programme.title: Nordland 99
programme.desc: Neither Emma nor Christian can get hold of Lukas, and they must form an unexpected alliance to find him. At the same time, Lukas tries to find a way out of the darkness that surrounds him.

This mysterious tiny Terrier arrived at Battersea scared and confused, and in desperate need of some love and attention, which Paul is only too happy to offer! But with the vets having no idea what breed of dog the father is, Baubles labour could be anything but straightforward.

programme.title: Inside Oxford Street
programme.desc: In this episode, we shadow a team of twenty night workers who close Oxford street to install the Christmas lights. Theyre challenged with fitting panels 30 feet in the air which get heavier each year, whilst navigating metres of wires tangled overhead.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Singer-songwriter and talent-show judge Pixie Lott hopes to confirm the family story that she has Italian ancestry from Verona but instead discovers ancestors battling poverty and hardship in London. programme.desc: Darcey Bussells road trip continues in the heart of the Queens realm, London and the South-East. In Richmond Park, Darcey visits the hunting lodge where the Queen spent the first year of her life. Its also a trip down memory lane for Darcey because White Lodge was her childhood home too.

programme.title: Such Was Life
programme.desc: Teenage, Clara Saunders was the First woman to be married in Coolgardie. The event was so unique that hundreds of miners came to witness the occasion and the party lasted for two days. Her story, and a remarkable collection of brides and bridal parties from the 1890s through to WW2 held by the Eastern Goldfields Historical Society, provided the starting point for this look at the fashions and customs of the times.

programme.title: The Cook Up with Adam Liaw
programme.desc: Adam, food icon Maggie Beer and Baker Natalie Paull are in the kitchen making savoury dishes that can be the centre of your Christmas buffet.

programme.title: London Zoo at Christmas
programme.desc: Go behind the scenes at the iconic London Zoo, and witness a glimpse into what goes on as they prepare to celebrate the most wonderful time of the year. An exclusive look into the daily routine of the worlds oldest scientific zoo and discover how the keepers and staff make the holiday magic happen.

programme.title: Big Fat Quiz of Everything
programme.desc: Who were Henry VIIIs Grooms of the Stool? What did the very first meme say? What do Cilla Black, Pete Tong and Nelson Mandela have in common? All these questions and more will be answered in The Big Fat Quiz of Everything. Question master Jimmy Carr is joined by Harry Hill, David Mitchell, Roisin Conaty, Sophie Willan, Josh Pugh and Fatiha El-Ghorri as they battle it out to see who knows the most about everything!

programme.title: Rock Legends
programme.desc: The stratospheric career of Elton John. The Rocket Man that made the piano player a rock star, this documentary follows a journey from budding songwriter, to his 70s peak as the one of the most prolific artists of his generation, his flamboyant costumes and classic songs and closing with being one of the very few musicians who can still top the charts 45 years into their career.

programme.title: Crime
programme.desc: Lennox is struggling emotionally following his confrontation with Confectioner but is forced to get his head back into his current case when the attacker floods the internet with their manifesto and declares there will be a third victim. The race is on for Lennox and his team to prevent another death. A new lead suggests the victims knew each other and puts disgraced politician and Lennoxs nemesis, Ritchie Gulliver, in the firing line as victim number three.

programme.title: The 2010s
programme.desc: It begins with President Barack Obama announcing to the world that Osama Bin Laden has been killed in a Special Operations raid in Pakistan. We examine why Obama is often called the "Consoler In Chief," revisiting moments when he responded to tragedy.

programme.title: Mirusia - Live In Concert
programme.desc: On a balmy summers evening in Mirusias hometown of Brisbane, a special musical event took place at the Redland Performing Arts Centre. Mirusia returned to the stage for her first concert of 2021 performing to a hometown crowd of music lovers. An intimate concert of songs joined by fine musicians and singers alike delivering what can only be described as a vocal tour de force by Australias songbird, Mirusia.

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: When Gemma discovers she is pregnant, she only has her hapless father for support. Malcolm, a sweet man in crisis must learn to rebuild his life and his relationship with Gemma.

programme.title: Il Colibri
programme.desc: Il Colibri tells the life of Marco Carrera, known as "the hummingbird", navigating love, loss, and fate from the 1970s to the near future. His life intertwines with unfulfilled love and challenging destiny.

programme.title: The Boy and the Heron
programme.desc: A grieving boy enters a mysterious tower, meeting a trickster heron who guides him through fantastical worlds. As reality blurs, he confronts loss, courage, and the fragile balance holding both realms together.

programme.title: The Red Turtle
programme.desc: Gorgeously animated, this wordless story about a stranded castaway pays tribute to whats most important in life: companionship, love, family, and the stewardship of nature.

programme.title: Ponyo
programme.desc: This animated adventure, from acclaimed anime master Hayao Miyazaki, centres on five-year-old Sosuke and his friendship with Ponyo, a goldfish princess who longs to become human. When a powerful magic threatens to destroy the world, the two friends embark on the adventure of a lifetime to save the planet. Nominated for the Golden Lion at the 2008 Venice Film Festival. Voiced by Cate Blanchett, Matt Damon and Liam Neeson.

programme.title: Hachi: A Dogs Tale
programme.desc: Golden Globe winner Richard Gere stars as Professor Parker Wilson, a distinguished scholar who discovers a lost Akita puppy on his way home from work. Despite initial objections from his wife Hachi endears himself to the Wilson family and grows to be Parkers loyal companion. As their bond grows deeper, a beautiful relationship unfolds, embodying the true spirit of family and loyalty, while inspiring the hearts of an entire town.

programme.title: Year of the Dog
programme.desc: Peggy is a happy-go-lucky secretary who is a great friend, co-worker, and sister living alone with her beloved dog, Pencil. But a sudden turn of events sends Peggy into a dog-eat-dog world.

programme.title: Kikis Delivery Service
programme.desc: A young witch, on her mandatory year of independent life, finds fitting into a new community difficult while she supports herself by running an air courier service. Directed by Hayao Miyazaki.

programme.title: Starring Dick Van Dyke
programme.desc: For eight decades Dick has delighted audiences on screen and stage in such classic films as Mary Poppins, and Chitty Chitty Bang Bang, the hit Broadway musical Bye Bye Birdie, the TV series Diagnosis Murder and his iconic sitcom, The Dick Van Dyke Show. This definitive documentary features rare and never-before-seen footage, photos, home movies and performance clips, as well as new, exclusive interviews with Julie Andrews, Jim Carrey, Ted Danson, Steve Martin, Martin Short and more.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A couples relationship unravels amid the absurdities of the California divorce system. Theyre pulled into a world of lawyers and alimony, revealing the emotional and financial toll of divorce.

programme.title: All Quiet on the Western Front
programme.desc: At the start of World War I, Paul Baumer is a young German patriot, eager to fight. Indoctrinated with propaganda at school, he and his friends eagerly sign up for the army soon after graduation. But when the horrors of war soon become too much to bear, and as his friends die or become gravely wounded, Paul questions the sanity of it all.

programme.title: Mosley
programme.desc: After many years of servitude on an isolated farm owned by Simon, a sullen and mean-spirited farmer, Mosley and his family of four-legged thoriphants decide to rebel. When they discover a cave with ancient drawings on the walls - of thoriphants similar to them but standing upright - they embark on a dangerous journey to find the fabled city of Uprights.

programme.title: My Neighbour Totoro
programme.desc: The story follows Satsuke and Mai, two young girls who find their new country home is in a mystical forest inhabited by a menagerie of mystical creatures called Totoros. They befriend O Totoro, the biggest and eldest Totoro, who is also the king of the forest. As their girls mother lies sick in the hospital, O Totoro brings the sisters on a magical adventure but also helps them to understand the realities of life.

programme.title: Bye Bye Birdie
programme.desc: When the draft selects rock star Conrad Birdie, his fans are devastated, but none more than struggling songwriter Albert Peterson, whose song Birdie was just about to record. Alberts longtime girlfriend, Rosie, pushes Albert to write a new tune that Birdie will perform on television to a fan selected in a contest. The scheme works, with young Ohio teenager Kim McAfee declared the winner, but no one has counted on the jealous wrath of her boyfriend. Stars Dick Van Dyke, Ann-Margaret and Janet Leigh.

programme.title: The Comic
programme.desc: Step into the golden age of Hollywood with Billy Bright, a slapstick legend whose rise to fame is as hilarious as his downfall is shocking. Packed with sharp satire, big laughs, and a bittersweet look behind the curtain of showbiz, The Comic delivers a fast, funny, and unforgettable ride through the life of a comedy genius who just cant get out of his own way. A must-see for film lovers and comedy fans alike.

Meanwhile, House uncharacteristically attempts to alleviate his conscience by reaching out to a former medical school colleague he wronged.
